00031 /* ~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=~=

00049  *                                          Common
00050  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

00052 
00053 /* Packet automation control - base value is power up value whick has APPEND_STATUS enabled; no CRC autoflush */
00054 #define PKTCTRL1_BASE_VALUE         BV(2)
00055 #define PKTCTRL1_ADDR_FILTER_OFF    PKTCTRL1_BASE_VALUE
00056 #define PKTCTRL1_ADDR_FILTER_ON     (PKTCTRL1_BASE_VALUE | (BV(0)|BV(1)))
00057 
00058 #ifdef MRFI_ASSERTS_ARE_ON
00059 #define RX_FILTER_ADDR_INITIAL_VALUE  0xFF
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 
00063 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00064  *                                       Radio Abstraction
00065  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00066  */
00067 
00068 /* ----- Radio Family 1 ----- */
00069 #if (defined MRFI_RADIO_FAMILY1)
00070 #include "../family1/mrfi_spi.h"
00071 #define MRFI_WRITE_REGISTER(x,y)      mrfiSpiWriteReg( x, y )
00072 
00073 /* ----- Radio Family 2 ----- */
00074 #elif (defined MRFI_RADIO_FAMILY2)
00075 #define MRFI_WRITE_REGISTER(x,y)      st( x = y; )
00076 
00077 /* unknown or missing radio family */
00078 #else
00079 #error "ERROR: Expected radio family not specified.  Most likely a project issue."
00080 #endif
00081

00083 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00084  *                                    Global Constants
00085  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00086  */
00087 const uint8_t mrfiBroadcastAddr[] = { 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xFF };
00088 
00089 /* verify number of table entries matches the corresponding #define */
00090 BSP_STATIC_ASSERT(MRFI_ADDR_SIZE == ((sizeof(mrfiBroadcastAddr)/sizeof(mrfiBroadcastAddr[0])) * sizeof(mrfiBroadcastAddr[0])));

00093 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00094  *                                    Local Constants
00095  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

00098 /*
00099  *  Logical channel table - this table translates logical channel into
00100  *  actual radio channel number.  Channel 0, the default channel, is
00101  *  determined by the channel exported from SmartRF Studio.  The other
00102  *  table entries are derived from that default.  Each derived channel is
00103  *  masked with 0xFF to prevent generation of an illegal channel number.
00104  *
00105  *  This table is easily customized.  Just replace or add entries as needed.
00106  *  If the number of entries changes, the corresponding #define must also
00107  *  be adjusted.  It is located in mrfi_defs.h and is called __mrfi_NUM_LOGICAL_CHANS__.
00108  *  The static assert below ensures that there is no mismatch.
00109  */
00110 #if defined( MRFI_CC2500 ) || defined( MRFI_CC2510 ) || defined( MRFI_CC2511 )
00111 static const uint8_t mrfiLogicalChanTable[] =
00112 {
00113   SMARTRF_SETTING_CHANNR,
00114   103,
00115   202,
00116   212
00117 };
00118 #elif defined( MRFI_CC1100 ) || defined( MRFI_CC1101 ) || defined( MRFI_CC1110 ) || defined( MRFI_CC1111 )
00119 static const uint8_t mrfiLogicalChanTable[] =
00120 {
00121   SMARTRF_SETTING_CHANNR,
00122   50,
00123   80,
00124   110
00125 };
00126 #elif defined(MRFI_CC1100E_470)
00127 static const uint8_t mrfiLogicalChanTable[] =
00128 {
00129   SMARTRF_SETTING_CHANNR,
00130   40,
00131   60,
00132   80
00133 };
00134 #elif defined(MRFI_CC1100E_950)
00135 static const uint8_t mrfiLogicalChanTable[] =
00136 {
00137   SMARTRF_SETTING_CHANNR,
00138   10,
00139   15,
00140   20
00141 };
00142 #else
00143 #error "ERROR: A valid radio is not specified."
00144 #endif
00145 
00146 /* verify number of table entries matches the corresponding #define */
00147 BSP_STATIC_ASSERT(__mrfi_NUM_LOGICAL_CHANS__ == ((sizeof(mrfiLogicalChanTable)/sizeof(mrfiLogicalChanTable[0])) * sizeof(mrfiLogicalChanTable[0])));
00148 
00149 /*
00150  *  RF Power setting table - this table translates logical power value
00151  *  to radio register setting.  The logical power value is used directly
00152  *  as an index into the power setting table. The values in the table are
00153  *  from low to high. The default settings set 3 values: -20 dBm, -10 dBm,
00154  *  and 0 dBm. The default at startup is the highest value. Note that these
00155  *  are approximate depending on the radio. Information is taken from the
00156  *  data sheet.
00157  *
00158  *  This table is easily customized.  Just replace or add entries as needed.
00159  *  If the number of entries changes, the corresponding #define must also
00160  *  be adjusted.  It is located in mrfi_defs.h and is called __mrfi_NUM_POWER_SETTINGS__.
00161  *  The static assert below ensures that there is no mismatch.
00162  */
00163 #if defined( MRFI_CC2500 )
00164 static const uint8_t mrfiRFPowerTable[] =
00165 {
00166   0x46,
00167   0x97,
00168   0xFE
00169 };
00170 
00171 #elif defined( MRFI_CC2510 ) || defined( MRFI_CC2511 )
00172 static const uint8_t mrfiRFPowerTable[] =
00173 {
00174   0xC1,
00175   0xCB,
00176   0xFE
00177 };
00178 
00179 #elif defined( MRFI_CC1100 )
00180 static const uint8_t mrfiRFPowerTable[] =
00181 {
00182   0x0D,
00183   0x34,
00184   0x8E
00185 };
00186 
00187 #elif defined( MRFI_CC1101 )
00188 static const uint8_t mrfiRFPowerTable[] =
00189 {
00190   0x0F,
00191   0x27,
00192   0x50
00193 };
00194 
00195 #elif defined( MRFI_CC1110 ) || defined( MRFI_CC1111 )
00196 static const uint8_t mrfiRFPowerTable[] =
00197 {
00198   0x0E,
00199   0x27,
00200   0x50
00201 };
00202 #elif defined(MRFI_CC1100E_470)
00203 static const uint8_t mrfiRFPowerTable[] =
00204 {
00205  0x0E,
00206  0x34,
00207  0x60
00208 };
00209 #elif defined(MRFI_CC1100E_950)
00210 static const uint8_t mrfiRFPowerTable[] =
00211 {
00212   0x0E,
00213   0x27,
00214   0x8E
00215 };
00216 #endif
00217 
00218 /* verify number of table entries matches the corresponding #define */
00219 BSP_STATIC_ASSERT(__mrfi_NUM_POWER_SETTINGS__ == ((sizeof(mrfiRFPowerTable)/sizeof(mrfiRFPowerTable[0])) * sizeof(mrfiRFPowerTable[0])));
00220 
00221 
00222 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00223  *                                       Local Variables
00224  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00225  */
00226 static uint8_t mrfiRxFilterEnabled=0;
00227 static uint8_t mrfiRxFilterAddr[MRFI_ADDR_SIZE] = { RX_FILTER_ADDR_INITIAL_VALUE };
00228 
00229 
00230 /**************************************************************************************************
00231  * @fn          MRFI_SetLogicalChannel
00232  *
00233  * @brief       Set logical channel.
00234  *
00235  * @param       chan - logical channel number
00236  *
00237  * @return      none
00238  **************************************************************************************************
00239  */
00240 void MRFI_SetLogicalChannel(uint8_t chan)
00241 {
00242   /* logical channel is not valid? */
00243   MRFI_ASSERT( chan < MRFI_NUM_LOGICAL_CHANS );
00244 
00245   /* make sure radio is off before changing channels */
00246   Mrfi_RxModeOff();
00247 
00248   MRFI_WRITE_REGISTER( CHANNR, mrfiLogicalChanTable[chan] );
00249 
00250   /* turn radio back on if it was on before channel change */
00251   if(mrfiRadioState == MRFI_RADIO_STATE_RX)
00252   {
00253     Mrfi_RxModeOn();
00254   }
00255 }
00256 
00257 /**************************************************************************************************
00258  * @fn          MRFI_SetRFPwr
00259  *
00260  * @brief       Set RF Output power level.
00261  *
00262  * @param       idx - index into power table.
00263  *
00264  * @return      none
00265  **************************************************************************************************
00266  */
00267 void MRFI_SetRFPwr(uint8_t idx)
00268 {
00269   /* is power level specified valid? */
00270   MRFI_ASSERT( idx < MRFI_NUM_POWER_SETTINGS );
00271 
00272   /* make sure radio is off before changing power levels */
00273   Mrfi_RxModeOff();
00274 
00275   MRFI_WRITE_REGISTER( PA_TABLE0, mrfiRFPowerTable[idx] );
00276 
00277   /* turn radio back on if it was on before power level change */
00278   if(mrfiRadioState == MRFI_RADIO_STATE_RX)
00279   {
00280     Mrfi_RxModeOn();
00281   }
00282 }
00283 
00284 /**************************************************************************************************
00285  * @fn          MRFI_SetRxAddrFilter
00286  *
00287  * @brief       Set the address used for filtering received packets.
00288  *
00289  * @param       pAddr - pointer to address to use for filtering
00290  *
00291  * @return      zero     : successfully set filter address
00292  *              non-zero : illegal address
00293  **************************************************************************************************
00294  */
00295 uint8_t MRFI_SetRxAddrFilter(uint8_t * pAddr)
00296 {
00297   /*
00298    *  If first byte of filter address match fir byte of broadcast address,
00299    *  there is a conflict with hardware filtering.
00300    */
00301   if (pAddr[0] == mrfiBroadcastAddr[0])
00302   {
00303     /* unable to set filter address */
00304     return( 1 );
00305   }
00306 
00307   /*
00308    *  Set the hardware address register.  The hardware address filtering only recognizes
00309    *  a single byte but this does provide at least some automatic hardware filtering.
00310    */
00311   MRFI_WRITE_REGISTER( ADDR, pAddr[0] );
00312 
00313   /* save a copy of the filter address */
00314   {
00315     uint8_t i;
00316 
00317     for (i=0; i<MRFI_ADDR_SIZE; i++)
00318     {
00319       mrfiRxFilterAddr[i] = pAddr[i];
00320     }
00321   }
00322 
00323   /* successfully set filter address */
00324   return( 0 );
00325 }
00326 
00327 
00328 /**************************************************************************************************
00329  * @fn          MRFI_EnableRxAddrFilter
00330  *
00331  * @brief       Enable received packet filtering.
00332  *
00333  * @param       none
00334  *
00335  * @return      none
00336  **************************************************************************************************
00337  */
00338 void MRFI_EnableRxAddrFilter(void)
00339 {
00340   MRFI_ASSERT(mrfiRxFilterAddr[0] != mrfiBroadcastAddr[0]); /* filter address must be set before enabling filter */
00341 
00342   /* set flag to indicate filtering is enabled */
00343   mrfiRxFilterEnabled = 1;
00344 
00345   /* enable hardware filtering on the radio */
00346   MRFI_WRITE_REGISTER( PKTCTRL1, PKTCTRL1_ADDR_FILTER_ON );
00347 }
00348 
00349 
00350 /**************************************************************************************************
00351  * @fn          MRFI_DisableRxAddrFilter
00352  *
00353  * @brief       Disable received packet filtering.
00354  *
00355  * @param       pAddr - pointer to address to test for filtering
00356  *
00357  * @return      none
00358  **************************************************************************************************
00359  */
00360 void MRFI_DisableRxAddrFilter(void)
00361 {
00362   /* clear flag that indicates filtering is enabled */
00363   mrfiRxFilterEnabled = 0;
00364 
00365   /* disable hardware filtering on the radio */
00366   MRFI_WRITE_REGISTER( PKTCTRL1, PKTCTRL1_ADDR_FILTER_OFF );
00367 }
00368 
00369 
00370 /**************************************************************************************************
00371  * @fn          MRFI_RxAddrIsFiltered
00372  *
00373  * @brief       Determine if address is filtered.
00374  *
00375  * @param       none
00376  *
00377  * @return      zero     : address is not filtered
00378  *              non-zero : address is filtered
00379  **************************************************************************************************
00380  */
00381 uint8_t MRFI_RxAddrIsFiltered(uint8_t * pAddr)
00382 {
00383   uint8_t i;
00384   uint8_t addrByte;
00385   uint8_t filterAddrMatches;
00386   uint8_t broadcastAddrMatches;
00387 
00388   /* first check to see if filtering is even enabled */
00389   if (!mrfiRxFilterEnabled)
00390   {
00391     /*
00392      *  Filtering is not enabled, so by definition the address is
00393      *  not filtered.  Return zero to indicate address is not filtered.
00394      */
00395     return( 0 );
00396   }
00397 
00398   /* clear address byte match counts */
00399   filterAddrMatches    = 0;
00400   broadcastAddrMatches = 0;
00401 
00402   /* loop through address to see if there is a match to filter address of broadcast address */
00403   for (i=0; i<MRFI_ADDR_SIZE; i++)
00404   {
00405     /* get byte from address to check */
00406     addrByte = pAddr[i];
00407 
00408     /* compare byte to filter address byte */
00409     if (addrByte == mrfiRxFilterAddr[i])
00410     {
00411       filterAddrMatches++;
00412     }
00413     if (addrByte == mrfiBroadcastAddr[i])
00414     {
00415       broadcastAddrMatches++;
00416     }
00417   }
00418 
00419   /*
00420    *  If address is *not* filtered, either the "filter address match count" or
00421    *  the "broadcast address match count" will equal the total number of bytes
00422    *  in the address.
00423    */
00424   if ((broadcastAddrMatches == MRFI_ADDR_SIZE) || (filterAddrMatches == MRFI_ADDR_SIZE))
00425   {
00426     /* address *not* filtered, return zero */
00427     return( 0 );
00428   }
00429   else
00430   {
00431     /* address filtered, return non-zero */
00432     return( 1 );
00433   }
00434 }
00435

00437 /**************************************************************************************************
00438  *                                  Compile Time Integrity Checks
00439  **************************************************************************************************
00440  */
00441 
00442 /*
00443  *  These asserts happen if there is extraneous compiler padding of arrays.
00444  *  Modify compiler settings for no padding, or, if that is not possible,
00445  *  comment out the offending asserts.
00446  */
00447 BSP_STATIC_ASSERT(sizeof(mrfiLogicalChanTable) == ((sizeof(mrfiLogicalChanTable)/sizeof(mrfiLogicalChanTable[0])) * sizeof(mrfiLogicalChanTable[0])));
00448 BSP_STATIC_ASSERT(sizeof(mrfiBroadcastAddr) == ((sizeof(mrfiBroadcastAddr)/sizeof(mrfiBroadcastAddr[0])) * sizeof(mrfiBroadcastAddr[0])));
00449
